FeatureItem.Name: Editing Settings
FeatureItem.Description:
[{bold}HTML Validation]
ASPxHtmlEditor automatically performs the validation of HTML code. This section allows you to customize the validation settings. The [{SettingsHtmlEditing.AllowedDocumentType}AllowedDocumentType] property specifies what document types are allowed in the editor. Elements that do not conform to the rules of specified document type are removed.
Use the 'Allow' properties to specify elements that will be removed from code.
[{bold}Content Element Filtering]
The ASPxHtmlEditor can automatically filter the following content elements.
- Attributes (specify the list of [{SettingsHtmlEditing.ContentElementFiltering.Attributes}Attributes] and [{SettingsHtmlEditing.ContentElementFiltering.AttributeFilterMode}AttributeFilterMode]) - Style attributes (specify the list of [{SettingsHtmlEditing.ContentElementFiltering.StyleAttributes}StyleAttributes] and [{SettingsHtmlEditing.ContentElementFiltering.StyleAttributeFilterMode}StyleAttributeFilterMode]) - Tags (specify the list of [{SettingsHtmlEditing.ContentElementFiltering.Tags}Tags] and [{SettingsHtmlEditing.ContentElementFiltering.TagFilterMode}TagFilterMode])
[{bold}Paste Formatting]
The editor automatically formats pasted HTML content based on the [{SettingsHtmlEditing.PasteMode}PasteMode] property. To allow end-users to change formatting of the pasted HTML content, enable the [{SettingsHtmlEditing.EnablePasteOptions}EnablePasteOptions] property.
To learn more, see the [{lnk_#AspNet/CustomDocument7840}Content Filtering and Validation] documentation topic.
